Text: The Black Mirror plot about AI that worries actors As actors strike in Hollywood, unions say they want more protection from artificial intelligence.
Summarized_Data: – Hollywood actors are striking for the first time in 43 years, bringing the American movie and television business to a halt, partly over fears about the impact of artificial intelligence (AI). The Screen Actors Guild (SAG-AFTRA) actors' union failed to reach an agreement in the US for better protections against AI for its members - and warned that "artificial intelligence poses an existential threat to creative professions" as it prepared to dig in over the issue. Duncan Crabtree-Ireland, the chief negotiator for the SAG-AFTRA union, criticized producers for their proposals over AI so far. He said studios had asked for the ability to scan the faces of background artists for the payment of one day's work, and then be able to own and use their likeness "for the rest of eternity, in any project they want, with no consent and no compensation." Perhaps it is only a question of time before ChatGPT or Bard can conjure up an innovative movie script or turn an idea into a blockbuster screenplay.

Text: $39bn in US student loan relief for thousands The relief will help some 800,000 borrowers enrolled in income-driven repayment plans, officials say.
Summarized_Data: – The Biden administration has announced it has forgiven $39bn (£29.7bn) in student loan debt for 804,000 borrowers who have income-driven repayment plans. The announcement comes weeks after the US Supreme Court struck down President Joe Biden's broader student loan plan. The move would fix administrative errors that meant some borrowers' payments did not count toward them qualifying for student loan relief, the education department said. "For far too long, borrowers fell through the cracks of a broken system that failed to keep accurate track of their progress towards forgiveness," US Secretary of Education Miguel Cardona said in a statement. The US government offers multiple types of income-driven repayment plans, known as IDR plans, under which borrowers make a monthly loan payment based on their income over the course of 20 or 25 years. The administration first announced it would make changes to the plan in April 2022 to address "historical inaccuracies in the count of payments that qualify toward forgiveness under IDR plans."

Text: Europe bakes as record temperatures expected The European Space Agency says Italy, Spain, France, Germany and Poland may see extreme conditions.
Summarized_Data: – Much of southern Europe is baking in extreme heat, with Greece seeing temperatures of 40C (104F) or more.The Acropolis, the country's most popular tourist attraction, was closed during the hottest hours of the day to protect visitors.The European Space Agency (ESA) says Italy, Spain, France, Germany and Poland may see extreme conditions.The hottest temperature ever recorded in Europe was 48.8C in Sicily in August 2021. Earlier on Friday at least one tourist was stretchered out of the site after falling ill due to the heat, local police said.The cause is the Cerberus heatwave - named by the Italian Meteorological Society after the three-headed monster that features in Dante's Inferno.People have been advised to drink at least two liters of water a day and to avoid coffee and alcohol, which are dehydrating. Periods of intense heat occur within natural weather patterns, but globally they are becoming more frequent, more intense and are lasting longer due to global warming.

Text: Arrest made in Long Island serial killer case Police have been working for over a decade to solve the murders of at least 10 women in Long Island.
Summarized_Data: – An arrest has been made in the decade-long unsolved murders of at least 10 women in Long Island, New York. The suspect is set to be arraigned Friday after his arrest Thursday night in Manhattan, officials said. Officers also raided a small red house on Friday morning in connection to the "Long Island serial killer" case, the AP reported. Police said the arrest was a major step towards justice for victims and families. At a news conference on Friday, Suffolk County Executive Steve Bellone said police have been focused on "bringing justice for these victims and closure to these families who have suffered."

Text: Drone shows great white sharks swimming under surfers
Summarized_Data: – A 13-year-old boy was seriously injured when a great white shark attacked him as he was playing near his family's home in Jacksonville, Fla., on Sunday. Police say the boy was playing with friends about a half-mile from his family's home when he was attacked by the shark, which was about 10 feet long, the AP reports. The boy was rushed to a local hospital, where he was treated for bites on his leg, arm, and hand. The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission says it's not clear whether the shark was a great white or a tiger shark.

Text: A surfboard-stealing otter is on the run
Summarized_Data: – She has developed a knack for theft and a taste for surfboards.Small and dark, whiskered and fluffy, she has developed a knack for theft and a taste for surfboards.This week, the US Fish and Wildlife Service announced it had launched a multi-agency search for Otter 841 in an attempt to capture and rehome her, after observing her "concerning and unusual behavior." Teams from the US and state wildlife agencies have been sent out to sea, armed with a bait surfboard, but so far, she has evaded apprehension. Otter 841's capture will mark the end of her brief reign of terror and delight along the balmy coast of Santa Cruz - a story of fearlessness, crime and, possibly, a southern sea otter's family legacy.The complete tale of Otter 841 begins a little over five years ago, with a different otter, Otter 723 (otters who are released into the environment get numbers for names, those who stay in captivity get names).Living in the wild in the central coast of California, Otter 723 was fed by humans and soon became habituated to people, and their snacks.And in her first year back in the sea, Otter 841 swam, ate and floated around California's central coast without incident, alongside a small population of other otters.She was raised in the Monterey Bay Aquarium, where researchers took precautions to stop her mother's love of humans from being passed on.The behavior was highly unusual.

Text: An unsolved murder in Canada fuels rifts with India

Text: The unlikely hit film that became a political flashpoint
